alert.note: Alert for Upper Columbia Basin (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 1:50PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lincoln County through 215 PM PDT... At 150 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles west of Davenport. This storm is nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Lincoln County. This includes U.S. Highway 2 in Washington near mile marker 240. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
